issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) specifies that Animal.messageOnFeed() is an abstract method returning a String, but the solution's Animal.java declares messageOnFeed() to return a FeedResponse. This is a cross-artifact return-type mismatch: students reading the exercise will implement messageOnFeed() to return String (as required by the spec/UML), but the solution uses a different return type (FeedResponse), creating confusion about the intended API and expected implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the messageOnFeed() return type across artifacts. Preferably, follow the problem statement and make messageOnFeed() return String everywhere (remove or stop using FeedResponse), updating Animal.java (abstract method), Seal/Pig/Goat implementations to return String, and adjust any code that constructs or expects FeedResponse. Alternatively, if FeedResponse is intentionally desired, update the problem statement and UML to specify messageOnFeed(): FeedResponse and document the FeedResponse class in the spec/template.

issues.description: Within the solution repository there is an internal signature mismatch: Animal.messageOnFeed() is declared to return FeedResponse, Pig and Seal implement FeedResponse-returning messageOnFeed(), but Goat implements messageOnFeed() with a String return type. This inconsistency causes a compile-time override/signature conflict and prevents the solution from compiling and from being a clear reference for students.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution internally consistent: either change Goat.messageOnFeed() to return FeedResponse (and construct an appropriate FeedResponse) so all subclasses match Animal, or change Animal to declare messageOnFeed() returning String and update Pig and Seal to return String (and remove FeedResponse). Prefer matching the problem statement (String) unless FeedResponse is intentionally part of the design — in that case update all animal classes and the problem text/UML accordingly.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) specifies that Animal.messageOnFeed() is an abstract method returning a String (see UML: messageOnFeed():String) and the song printing expects the method's return value to be a plain string to be printed. The solution repository, however, introduces a new class FeedResponse and changes Animal.messageOnFeed() to return FeedResponse. Additionally, in the provided solution files this is inconsistently applied (e.g. Goat.messageOnFeed() returns a String while Animal.messageOnFeed() is declared to return FeedResponse). This mismatch (String vs FeedResponse) and the introduction of the FeedResponse type is not reflected in the problem statement or the template and will confuse students: they expect to implement and use messageOnFeed() as String-based while the solution uses a different named concept (FeedResponse).
issues.suggested_fix:
Unify the representation of the feed message across all artifacts. Two acceptable fixes (pick one and apply consistently):

1) Revert to the problem-stated design: make Animal.messageOnFeed() return String everywhere (update solution Animal, Pig, Seal to return String and remove FeedResponse). Update any code that constructs FeedResponse to directly return the message String.

2) Adopt the FeedResponse approach explicitly: update the problem statement and the UML to declare messageOnFeed(): FeedResponse (and describe FeedResponse in the text), update the template code/comments to mention FeedResponse, and ensure all solution implementations consistently return FeedResponse (fix Goat to return FeedResponse).

Either way, keep the name and type consistent across problem statement, template, and solution so students can directly map the requirement (messageOnFeed) to the expected implementation and printed output.
